thread.title: Reports of shots fired at Oklahoma City metro school panics parents
thread.title_full: Reports of shots fired at Oklahoma City metro school panics parents

author: Meghan Mosley
title: Reports of shots fired at Oklahoma City metro school panics parents
text:
Reports of shots fired at Oklahoma City metro school panics parents
Reports of shots fired near a local school Wednesday afternoon sent parents into panic
Reports of shots fired near a local school Wednesday afternoon sent parents into panic
Reports of shots fired near a local school Wednesday afternoon sent parents into panic
Reports of shots fired near a local school Wednesday afternoon sent parents into panic.
KOCO 5 spoke with Spence Police Department officials who said there was no active threat Wednesday, and they responded out of precaution.
It was a lot quieter about 3 p.m. Wednesday after Spencer Elementary School let their students out, but when KOCO 5 showed up to the scene a few hours prior, parents were in a panicked state and picking up their students early after being notified the school was on “secure status.”
Parents were notified by a Wednesday email saying the status was because of reports of possible gunshots.
Spencer police officials said there was no school involvement, there was no active shooting, and that a neighbor in the area was shooting their gun.
In the email sent to parents, school officials explained that “secure status” means no one is allowed in or out of the building, but normal school activities inside the building continue.
They said all of the students were safe but because they wanted to be transparent, they were informing the parents about the situation.
However, a mother KOCO 5 spoke with said even though it was out of precaution, she still rushed to get her fourth-grade son because she feared the worst.
Get the latest news stories of interest by clicking here.
“My mama called me and told me it was a shooting at the school. So, I dropped everything and took off,” said Lashay Penon. “It was too close. It was too close, so of course, I’m on my way it was too close.”
